Description: The Department of Justice and the Environmental Protection Agency announced a settlement with ASARCO requiring the company to spend $150 million to install new equipment and pollution control technology to reduce emissions of toxic heavy metals at a large smelter located in Hayden, Arizona. The company also agreed to fund local environmental projects valued at $8 million, replace a diesel locomotive with a cleaner model for $1 million, and pay a $4.5 million civil penalty.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/us-epa-requires-asarco-cut-toxic-emissions-103-year-old-arizona-copper-smelter
Taken from the Federal Railroad Administration's FY2008 safety penalty report obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request. A copy is available upon request.
Taken from the Federal Railroad Administration's FY2005 safety penalty report obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request. A copy is available upon request.

Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency announced that it fined Asarco LLC $30,900 for using buildings contaminated with PCBs and improper management of PCB waste. The company will also spend $115,714 to reduce PCBs at their copper smelter located in Hayden, Ariz.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/2d134e6ee7e24e4f85257beb0058e870.html

Agency: Interior Department Office of Natural Resources Revenue
Info Source: https://www.onrr.gov/compliance/PDFDocs/2018.pdf

Description: ASARCO was found guilty of failing to prevent sexual harassment and ordered to pay $868,751 in damages.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20120413010906/http://www.azag.gov/press_releases/april/2011/ASARCO%204-28-11.html

Description: ASARCO, Inc. agreed to pay $77,500 in settlement of allegations of air quality violations relating to dust emissions.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20080616200202/http://www.azag.gov/press_releases/april/2007/ASARCOJudgment.pdf

Description: Resurrection/Newmont USA agreed to pay $10.5 million in settlement of alleged natural resource damages in California Gulch, where mining contaminated the environment with zinc, lead, cadmium and arsenic. Joint venture partner ASARCO agreed to pay $10 million over the same allegations.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20150927042305/http://www.coloradoattorneygeneral.gov/press/news/2008/07/01/attorney_general_suthers_and_governor_ritter_announce_california_gulch_settlem

Description: ASARCO LLC agreed to pay $143 million to clean up industrial and mining sites it owned, in settlement of allegations it contaminated groundwater and soil with lead smelting in East Helena and mining operations in Upper Blackfoot River, Iron Mountain and Black Pine districts sites.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20090310033015/http://doj.mt.gov/news/releases2008/20080731.asp

Description: Atlantic Richfield Co. and ASARCO LLC agreed to pay a total of $37 million in settlement of allegations they contaminated the Upper Blackfoot River with mine trailings.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20090310033014/http://doj.mt.gov/news/releases2008/20080425.asp

Description: ASARCO and certain related companies agreed to pay $42 million to the state and federal government in settlement of allegations it had environmental liabilities from its mining, smelting, and refining facilities in Colorado.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20150908202126/http://www.coloradoattorneygeneral.gov/press/news/2009/11/24/attorney_general_announces_colorado_federal_government_will_recover_more_42_mi
Extracted from a spreadsheet obtained from the NLRB through a Freedom of Information Act request fulfilled on 5/28/2020.
Extracted from a spreadsheet obtained from the NLRB through a Freedom of Information Act request fulfilled on 5/28/2020.

Description: Clean Air Act
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/newsreleases/asarcos-arizona-copper-smelter-fined-33000-failing-comply-epa-settlement
https://legacy.azdeq.gov/function/news/2014/download/0724_114.pdf
https://legacy.azdeq.gov/function/news/2010/download/041210.pdf

Description: Asarco agreed to allow an unsecured claim for $3,773,604 divided between the United States and the state of Arizona (considered equal shares for voting purposes, so state share recorded here as $1,886,802) as part of a settlement of allegations Asarco was liable for natural resource damages caused by releases at the Ray Mine and the Hayden facility.
Info Source: https://legacy.azdeq.gov/function/news/2009/download/0519az.pdf

Description: In a settlement with the United States and the states of Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, Colorado, Illinois, Indiana,  New Mexico,  Ohio, Oklahoma, Utah, and Washington,  Asarco LLC and affiliated debtors agreed to pay $10,400,000 to a Custodial Trust Administrative Account and $60,555,493 to the Custodial Trust Environmental Cost Accounts, in settlement of alleged environmental damages caused by its mining facilities. Arizona was paid $20 million to fund environmental action in respect the the Sacaton Site near Case Grande, plus $2.825 million for the Trench Mine and Salero sites.
Info Source: https://legacy.azdeq.gov/function/news/2009/download/0519multi.pdf
Notes: Penalty listed is the settlement amount paid to Arizona.

Description: Asarco agreed to pay up to $880,000 into a fund to pay for cleanup of the former Helvetia Mine site near Tucson in settlement of allegations the area was contaminated with hazardous material.
Info Source: https://legacy.azdeq.gov/function/news/2008/download/1003.pdf

Description: Asarco agreed to pay $13.5 million for cleanup of areas around its mines in Hayden and Winkelman in a settlement with the state of Arizona and the EPA of allegations the area was contaminated with hazardous material by its mining activity.
Info Source: https://legacy.azdeq.gov/function/news/2008/download/0619.pdf
Contained in data received from the agency on November 10, 2020 in response to an open records request.

Description: hazardous waste violation
Info Source: Contained in a spreadsheet received from the agency on October 2, 2020 in response to an open records request. The spreadsheet included data from  the agency's Oculus database, which can be searched at https://prodenv.dep.state.fl.us/DepNexus/public/searchPortal
Notes: Case number is the designation given by the DEP's Office of General Counsel.

Info Source: https://railroads.dot.gov/elibrary/fiscal-year-2020-enforcement-report

Description: Asarco won approval from a bankruptcy court to pay $27.9 million to settle hundreds of toxic torts suits relating to its operations in Arizona, Oklahoma and Texas.
Court: Southern District of Texas Bankruptcy Court
Private Litigation Case Title: In re: Asarco LLC et al.
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/47800/asarco-27-9m-settlement-deal-approved
